snippet: Instead of paying a slice of their profits, companies could turn over nonvoting stock to the government.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economist Dean Baker asserts efforts American companies devote to avoiding onerous corporate taxes squander resources better spent on innovation; suggests instead of being taxed, companies should hand over certain amount of nonvoting stock to government, assuring its profits are shared by government and eliminating corporate incentive to minimize tax liability.
lead_paragraph: Instead of paying a slice of their profits, companies could turn over nonvoting stock to the government.

headline.main: A Progressive Way to End Corporate Taxes
